text:
*A general question about the HubSpot API.* 
Assume: A company has a large team of sales representatives who look after customers locally. New leads should automatically be assigned the property "Contact ownership" with a HubSpot user. What is the best way to do this and is it possible to use the API for it?

*Requirements, the idea:*
• Trigger form with the lead or contact
• Extend HubSpot User with address information
• Conversion of the address data into geographic coordinates
• Find closest HubSpot user based on the coordinates
• Set the contact property "ownership"
• When deleting a hubSpot user recalculation for all contacts without assigned "ownership"
A comparison based on the postcode appears to be too high in terms of maintenance.
Hello good morning, I need help with API CRM
Hey <@U019VKH09BN> this ended up being a bug in how Austin was making an API call, everything should be working with the Visitor Identification API. are you having any issues?
Im doing it more or less in the same way as Austin so I'm curious what method I should use instead.
The method was actually correct, there was just a syntax error
<@U01E3ENG4HG> what is your pb ?

<@UFBNA9K9A> might be worth re-posting this as its own thread; I haven't hit this yet but also have code that uses batch endpoints but doesn't know how to handle 207s... there are probably lots of others who should know about this!
Good point. I’m in the process of writing up some information on 207s, like when to expect them and we hope you do with them. I’ll post something to <#C2YHAHB6K|api>  at the top level for sure
You can receive webhooks on Contact Updates.

<@U01DF3PNCKA> I'm integrating HubSpot with my ERP MarketUp system, I'm in the process of synchronizing Budgets (orders), but in the APIs docs, the quotes endpoint returns me only the budget name and some metadata such as: creation date, last update, and I need more information

Hi all!

Is there somewhere in the doc where we can find all the domains and IP HubSpot is using to for APIs and Webhooks?  For instance Braintree has this page <https://developers.braintreepayments.com/reference/general/braintree-ip-addresses> I would like to see the same for HubSpot. Thanks

Hi there!
I'm new to HubSpot and I want to get access to an exiting HubSpot application to use the API, what do I need to be able to make requests to that existing app?
They've already created me an account it is not a developer account!
you need to have access to the dev portal where the app is created or the app credentials (secret etc.)

<@UDU6KEBFB> thanks
Can give access to myself to the dev portal from the account I have?

Or, is this only possible from the creator developer account?

Hi, is there a way to post to the HubSpot api without needing an "app" or developer account and just use a simple api key? I'm a developer for a company that would like to add some custom object data associated with a particular company.
yup.  postman is the jam
would need to be developer acct creator.  whatchya doin :eyes:
Thanks
go get em tiger

Well, it is not a custom-built app.
We're using the stock product, does it also have client_id, secret, etc...?
Or, is this only possible by an api-key?
all that is in the app itself
<@U01D8GPG3C7> Hi Manoj! I’m also having this problem. Were you able to find another approach?

There is already an existing contact owner property on the contacts. Are you reusing that or making a new one?

"Find closest HubSpot user based on the coordinates" --> This will have to be done with completely external logic and data about the "Owners" in HubSpot, there is nothing that can do it inside there, because the Owners object stores nearly no info whatsoever about the Owner besides their name and email, and they have some fields like Phone number but API is not allowed to reach them

The deletion topic should be a separate script using shared code

The rest is generally possible.

What "more information"

Need much more detail / context

Part of the answer is raising tickets

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Sales-Email/IPs-to-whitelist-for-firewall-IMAP/m-p/183916>

They only list out Email IPs and not API IPs sadly
w/ no API key or dev portal you are hosed
only API key for simple dev
client_id client_secret etc only if you are making an OAuth based integration

the API key is the way to do it

you have to get it from the settings pages inside an account with the right amount of admin access
OAuth, you can make an app and grant it access to your account, but it is more of a pain to provision
